main event: Two people observed a bright meteor-like object in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, on July 7, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as multi-colored and comparable to a searchlight., It appeared as bright as a car headlight from a short distance., The object was visible for only a few seconds before it traveled toward the ground., Dr. Charles Olivier confirmed it as a bright meteor or fireball., Reports from witnesses living over two miles apart were collected and analyzed.
witness description: Robert Lynn, Associate Member of National Investigations Committee on Aerial Phenomena
